subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: After losing its two top quarterbacks to injuries earlier this season, Washington State held campuswide tryouts this week to find a scout team quarterback. “We actually just picked him this morning; I don’t know his name,” Coach Paul Wulff said Tuesday. “We went through a series of 29 kids who went through it. He’s a good kid. He’s a kid from the state of Washington. He’s a two-year starter at Woodinville High School.” And he does have a name: Peter Roberts. He will run the scout team while the third-stringer Marshall Lobbestael starts and two freshmen backups get practice time.
